llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach (value=1) was the dominant driver (SHAP +3.0887) — the use of ACH strongly increased the model score.
- amount_received (11995.4) and amount_paid (11995.4) both contributed positively (SHAP +0.8308 and +0.7868) — the relatively large, equal payment and receipt amounts increased the score.
- from_bank (20) reduced the score (SHAP −0.7736) — the sending bank ID tempered the flagging contribution.
- to_bank (11) increased the score (SHAP +0.4499) — the receiving bank ID added upward pressure on the score.
- dayofweek (5) increased the score (SHAP +0.3558) — the transaction occurring on day 5 (fact sheet mapping: day 5 = Saturday) modestly raised the score.

Conclusion:
The alert is primarily driven by the ACH payment method (payment_format_ach=1) together with sizable, identical payment and receipt amounts (amount_paid/amount_received = 11,995.4), with smaller opposing influence from the sending bank (from_bank=20) and additional upward influence from the receiving bank (to_bank=11) and the weekend timing (dayofweek=5). Based solely on these drivers, targeted review should focus on the ACH payment details, the matching amount values (amount_paid/amount_received), and the involved bank IDs (from_bank/to_bank).
